dublinCore.dc:title: 117 HR 9263 IH: Expose Biden’s Inflation, Deficits, and Economic Neglect Act of 2022
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Clyde (for himself, Mrs. Miller of Illinois, and Mr. Comer) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Oversight and Reform, and in addition to the Committee on the Judiciary, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

form.official-title: To require the Comptroller General of the United States to report on the impact of major rules on inflation and gross domestic product, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Expose Biden’s Inflation, Deficits, and Economic Neglect Act of 2022 or the Expose BIDEN Act.

section.header: Comptroller General Report on impact of major rules on inflation and gross domestic product

paragraph.text: Beginning on the date described under paragraph (2), the Comptroller General of the United States shall review each major rule to determine the impact of each such rule on the economy of the United States, including—

subparagraph.text: the impact of each such rule on—

clause.text: inflation in the United States; and
the gross domestic product of the United States; and

subparagraph.text: whether any such rule contributed to—

clause.text: an increase in inflation in the United States; or
a decline in the gross domestic product of the United States.

paragraph.text: The Comptroller General shall begin conducting the review required by paragraph (1) on—

subparagraph.text: the effective date, if the Director has issued two consecutive reports on the gross domestic product of the United States indicating a decline in such gross domestic product in the two quarters preceding the effective date; or

if the Director has not issued two consecutive reports on the gross domestic product of the United States indicating a decline in such gross domestic product in the two quarters preceding the effective date, whichever occurs first after the effective date:

clause.text: The first date on which the Director determines that the gross domestic product of the United States declined in the two quarters preceding such date.

The publication date of the first monthly report published by the Bureau of Labor Statistics that shows an increase of 5 percent or greater in the Consumer Price Index for All Urban Consumers (CPI–U) over a 12-month period.

subsection.text: Not later than 6 months after the date on which the Comptroller General begins conducting the review required by subsection (a), the Comptroller General shall submit to the President, Committee on Oversight and Reform of the House of Representatives, and the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs of the Senate a report on such review that includes—

paragraph.text: a description of any impact of such rules on—

subparagraph.text: inflation in the United States; and
the gross domestic product of the United States; and

paragraph.text: an identification of any such rule that the Comptroller General determines contributed to—

subparagraph.text: an increase in inflation in the United States; or
a decline in the gross domestic product of the United States.

subsection.header: Suspension of enforcement and promulgations of major rules during preparation of report
subsection.text: During the period in which the Comptroller General is preparing the report required by subsection (b)—

paragraph.text: no major rule may be enforced; and
no major rule may be promulgated.

subsection.header: Rescission and promulgation of rules that contribute to decline in GDP and inflation

paragraph.text: Following the submission of the report under subsection (b), the head of each relevant Federal agency shall permanently rescind any rule identified in the report as being shown to have contributed to—

subparagraph.text: an increase in inflation in the United States; or
a decline in the gross domestic product of the United States.

paragraph.text: The head of a Federal agency may not promulgate a rule to replace a rule rescinded under paragraph (1) before the sunset date unless such head demonstrates to the Comptroller General of the United States that such rule will not contribute to—

subparagraph.text: an increase in inflation in the United States; or
a decline in the gross domestic product of the United States.

paragraph.text: The term Director means the Secretary of Commerce, acting through the Director of the Bureau of Economic Analysis.
The term effective date means the date of the enactment of this Act.
The term major rule has the meaning given the term in section 804 of title 5, United States Code, except that such term does not include any rule issued before 12:00 p.m., January 20, 2021.
The term sunset date means the date that is three months after the first date after the effective date on which—

subparagraph.text: the Director issues a report indicating that the gross domestic product of the United States has—

clause.text: increased in the two consecutive quarters preceding the date on which the Director issues the report; and
met or exceeded the gross domestic product for the quarter preceding such two consecutive quarters; and

subparagraph.text: the Bureau of Labor Statistics publishes a monthly report that shows an increase of 2.5 percent or less in the Consumer Price Index for All Urban Consumers (CPI–U) over a 12-month period.
